2023 NBA Finals

The 2023 NBA Finals was the championship series of the National Basketball Association's (NBA) 2022–23 season, and the conclusion of the 2023 NBA playoffs. The series was played between the Eastern Conference champion Miami Heat and the Western Conference champion Denver Nuggets.

# Background

## Miami Heat

The Miami Heat entered the 2022–23 season with high expectations, having reached the Eastern Conference Finals the previous year. Led by head coach Erik Spoelstra, the team looked to build on their success with a roster that included established stars like Jimmy Butler, Bam Adebayo, and Kyle Lowry, as well as young talent like Tyler Herro and Caleb Martin. Throughout the season, the Heat demonstrated their resilience and depth, overcoming injuries and adversity to secure the eighth seed in the Eastern Conference playoffs.

## Denver Nuggets

The Denver Nuggets entered the 2022–23 season as one of the top contenders in the Western Conference, led by two-time NBA Most Valuable Player Nikola Jokić. Under the guidance of head coach Michael Malone, the Nuggets sought to build on their success from the previous season, when they reached the Western Conference Finals. With a roster that included talented players like Jamal Murray, Michael Porter Jr., and Aaron Gordon, the Nuggets looked to dominate the league with their high-powered offense and stifling defense.

## Road to the Finals

Both teams navigated their respective playoff brackets, overcoming stiff competition to reach the 2023 NBA Finals. The Miami Heat, as the eighth seed in the Eastern Conference, pulled off a historic upset in the first round, defeating the top-seeded Milwaukee Bucks in five games. They then dispatched the second-seeded Boston Celtics in seven games, before taking down the third-seeded Philadelphia 76ers in six games to reach the Eastern Conference Finals. There, they defeated the fifth-seeded New York Knicks in seven games to secure their spot in the NBA Finals.

The Denver Nuggets, meanwhile, cruised through the Western Conference playoffs, dispatching the seventh-seeded Los Angeles Clippers in five games in the first round. They then took down the second-seeded Memphis Grizzlies in six games, before sweeping the fourth-seeded Phoenix Suns in the Western Conference Finals to reach the NBA Finals.

## Regular season series

The Miami Heat and Denver Nuggets met twice during the 2022–23 regular season, with the Nuggets winning both games by a combined margin of 25 points. The first meeting took place on November 14, 2022, with the Nuggets prevailing 112–95 behind 21 points and 11 rebounds from Nikola Jokić. The second meeting occurred on March 13, 2023, with the Nuggets winning 123–119 in a high-scoring affair that saw Jamal Murray score 32 points.

# Series summary

The 2023 NBA Finals was a thrilling series that saw both teams give it their all in pursuit of the championship. The Miami Heat, led by Jimmy Butler's incredible all-around play, pushed the Denver Nuggets to the limit, but ultimately fell short. The Nuggets, meanwhile, were led by Nikola Jokić's dominate performance, as he averaged 28.8 points, 10.3 rebounds, and 7.8 assists per game throughout the series.

# Game summaries

## Game 1

The series opened on June 1, 2023, at Ball Arena in Denver, Colorado, with the Nuggets hosting the Heat in Game 1. The Nuggets came out strong, building a 15-point lead in the first quarter behind Nikola Jokić's 12 points. The Heat fought back in the second quarter, cutting the deficit to five points at halftime. However, the Nuggets pulled away in the second half, leading by as many as 20 points in the fourth quarter. The Heat made a late surge, but ultimately fell short, losing 123–107. Jokić finished with 27 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists, while Jimmy Butler led the Heat with 25 points, 13 rebounds, and 5 assists.

## Game 2

Game 2 took place on June 4, 2023, at Ball Arena, with the Nuggets looking to take a 2–0 lead in the series. The Heat came out strong, building a 12-point lead in the first quarter behind Tyler Herro's 15 points. However, the Nuggets fought back in the second quarter, cutting the deficit to two points at halftime. The game remained close throughout the third quarter, with the Nuggets taking a one-point lead into the fourth quarter. The Heat regained the lead in the fourth quarter, but the Nuggets pulled ahead in the final minute, winning 119–116. Jamal Murray led the Nuggets with 31 points, while Jimmy Butler scored 25 points for the Heat.

## Game 3

The series shifted to FTX Arena in Miami, Florida, for Game 3 on June 7, 2023. The Heat came out strong, building a 10-point lead in the first quarter behind Bam Adebayo's 12 points. The Nuggets fought back in the second quarter, cutting the deficit to three points at halftime. However, the Heat pulled away in the second half, leading by as many as 15 points in the fourth quarter. The Nuggets made a late surge, but ultimately fell short, losing 109–103. Jimmy Butler led the Heat with 28 points, 8 rebounds, and 5 assists, while Nikola Jokić scored 27 points for the Nuggets.

## Game 4

Game 4 took place on June 9, 2023, at FTX Arena, with the Heat looking to even the series at 2–2. The Nuggets came out strong, building a 12-point lead in the first quarter behind Nikola Jokić's 13 points. However, the Heat fought back in the second quarter, cutting the deficit to two points at halftime. The game remained close throughout the third quarter, with the Nuggets taking a one-point lead into the fourth quarter. The Heat regained the lead in the fourth quarter, but the Nuggets pulled ahead in the final minute, winning 124–118. Jamal Murray led the Nuggets with 33 points, while Jimmy Butler scored 29 points for the Heat.

## Game 5

The series returned to Ball Arena for Game 5 on June 12, 2023, with the Nuggets looking to take a 3–2 lead in the series. The Heat came out strong, building a 10-point lead in the first quarter behind Tyler Herro's 12 points. However, the Nuggets fought back in the second quarter, cutting the deficit to two points at halftime. The game remained close throughout the third quarter, with the Nuggets taking a one-point lead into the fourth quarter. The Heat regained the lead in the fourth quarter, but the Nuggets pulled ahead in the final minute, winning 122–115. Nikola Jokić led the Nuggets with 30 points, 13 rebounds, and 7 assists, while Jimmy Butler scored 26 points for the Heat.

The year 2023 in American television saw a significant number of notable events, including the launch of new networks and services, the debut of highly anticipated shows, and the conclusion of long-running series. This article provides an overview of the major happenings in American television during 2023.

# Notable Events

article:
History of Rock Climbing

Rock climbing, as a recreational activity, has a rich and diverse history that spans over a century. From its humble beginnings as a form of mountaineering to the modern day sport that we know today, rock climbing has evolved significantly over the years. This article aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the history of rock climbing, from its origins to the present day.

# Origins

The earliest recorded instances of rock climbing date back to ancient civilizations, where people would climb rocks and mountains for spiritual, hunting, or trading purposes. In ancient Greece, for example, the Oracle of Delphi was located on the slopes of Mount Parnassus, which required a climb to reach. Similarly, in ancient Tibet, Buddhist monks would climb mountains to meditate and seek enlightenment.

However, modern rock climbing as we know it today originated in the mid-19th century in Europe, particularly in the Alps. During this time, mountaineering became a popular activity among the upper class, and climbers began to seek out more challenging routes and peaks. The formation of the Alpine Club in London in 1857 marked the beginning of organized mountaineering, and rock climbing soon followed.

# 19th century

In the late 19th century, rock climbing began to take shape as a distinct activity from mountaineering. The development of new equipment, such as ropes, pitons, and carabiners, made it possible for climbers to tackle more difficult routes and terrain. The first rock climbing competition was held in 1865 in the Swiss Alps, and the sport quickly gained popularity throughout Europe.

One of the earliest and most influential rock climbers of this era was Albert Mummery, a British climber who made several notable ascents in the Alps. Mummery's approach to climbing was characterized by his emphasis on technical skill and his willingness to take risks, which set the stage for future generations of climbers.

# 1900s

The early 20th century saw significant advances in rock climbing technology and technique. The development of new equipment, such as the ice axe and crampons, allowed climbers to tackle more challenging terrain and conditions. The introduction of piton-based aid climbing also opened up new possibilities for climbers, particularly in the Alps.

During this period, rock climbing began to spread beyond Europe, with climbers in North America and Asia also taking up the sport. The formation of the American Alpine Club in 1902 and the Japan Alpine Club in 1905 marked the beginning of organized rock climbing in these regions.

# 1910s

The 1910s saw the rise of a new generation of rock climbers, who were influenced by the likes of Mummery and other early pioneers. One of the most notable climbers of this era was Geoffrey Winthrop Young, a British climber who made several notable ascents in the Alps and Dolomites.

Young's approach to climbing was characterized by his emphasis on style and aesthetics, and he is often credited with developing the concept of "free climbing," which emphasizes the use of only the hands, feet, and other body parts to make progress up a route.

# 1920s

The 1920s saw significant advances in rock climbing technique and equipment. The development of new pitons and carabiners made it possible for climbers to tackle more difficult routes, and the introduction of the "karabiner clip" revolutionized the sport by allowing climbers to quickly and easily attach and detach themselves from the rope.

During this period, rock climbing also became more formalized, with the establishment of the International Climbing and Mountaneering Federation (UIAA) in 1932. The UIAA established standardized rules and regulations for climbing competitions and helped to promote the sport globally.

# 1930s

The 1930s saw the rise of a new generation of rock climbers, who were influenced by the likes of Young and other early pioneers. One of the most notable climbers of this era was Anderl Heckmair, a German climber who made several notable ascents in the Alps and Dolomites.

Heckmair's approach to climbing was characterized by his emphasis on technical skill and his willingness to take risks, and he is often credited with developing the concept of "direct climbing," which emphasizes the use of the most direct and efficient route to the top of a climb.

# 1940s

The 1940s saw significant advances in rock climbing equipment and technique. The development of new materials, such as nylon and aluminum, made it possible for climbers to create lighter and more durable equipment. The introduction of the "quickdraw" also revolutionized the sport by allowing climbers to quickly and easily attach and detach themselves from the rope.

During this period, rock climbing also became more popular in North America, with the establishment of the Sierra Club in 1892 and the Appalachian Mountain Club in 1876. These organizations helped to promote the sport and provide access to climbing areas for members.

# 1950s

The 1950s saw the rise of a new generation of rock climbers, who were influenced by the likes of Heckmair and other early pioneers. One of the most notable climbers of this era was John Salathé, a Swiss-American climber who made several notable ascents in Yosemite National Park.

Salathé's approach to climbing was characterized by his emphasis on technical skill and his willingness to take risks, and he is often credited with developing the concept of "big wall climbing," which emphasizes the use of aid climbing techniques to ascend large, vertical walls.

# 1960s

The 1960s saw significant advances in rock climbing equipment and technique. The development of new materials, such as Kevlar and titanium, made it possible for climbers to create lighter and more durable equipment. The introduction of the "cams" also revolutionized the sport by allowing climbers to quickly and easily attach and detach themselves from the rock.

During this period, rock climbing also became more popular globally, with the establishment of the International Federation of Sport Climbing (IFSC) in 2007. The IFSC helped to promote the sport and provide access to climbing competitions for athletes from around the world.

# 1970s

The 1970s saw the rise of a new generation of rock climbers, who were influenced by the likes of Salathé and other early pioneers. One of the most notable climbers of this era was Reinhold Messner, an Italian climber who made several notable ascents in the Himalayas and Karakoram.

Messner's approach to climbing was characterized by his emphasis on technical skill and his willingness to take risks, and he is often credited with developing the concept of "alpine climbing," which emphasizes the use of lightweight equipment and efficient techniques to ascend complex routes.

# 1980s

The 1980s saw significant advances in rock climbing equipment and technique. The development of new materials, such as carbon fiber and ceramic, made it possible for climbers to create lighter and more durable equipment. The introduction of the "sport climbing" also revolutionized the sport by allowing climbers to focus on technical skill and physical fitness.

Hill's approach to climbing was characterized by her emphasis on technical skill and her willingness to take risks, and she is often credited with developing the concept of "free solo climbing," which emphasizes the use of only the hands, feet, and other body parts to make progress up a route without the use of ropes or other safety equipment.

The development of new materials, such as nanotube and graphene, made it possible for climbers to create lighter and more durable equipment. Big Brother Canada Season 11 was the eleventh season of the Canadian reality television series Big Brother Canada. The show premiered on March 8, 2023, on Global and concluded on May 11, 2023. The season was hosted by Arisa Cox and featured a cast of 16 new HouseGuests competing for the grand prize of $100,000 and the title of Big Brother Canada champion.

# Format

The format of Big Brother Canada Season 11 remained largely the same as previous seasons. A group of 16 HouseGuests, known as the "housemates," lived together in a custom-built house with cameras and microphones recording their every move, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Each week, the HouseGuests competed in challenges and voted each other off the show, with the last person standing winning the grand prize.

article:
2022 Ottawa Municipal Election

The 2022 Ottawa municipal election was held on October 24, 2022, to elect the mayor and city councillors for the city of Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. The election was part of the larger 2022 Ontario municipal elections.

# Background

The 2022 Ottawa municipal election was the first election since the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the city's finances and operations. The city was also facing several other challenges, including affordable housing, transportation, and environmental sustainability.

## Incumbents not running for re-election

Several incumbent city councillors announced that they would not be running for re-election, including Mayor Jim Watson, who had served as mayor since 2010.

# Mayoral candidates

A total of 14 candidates registered to run for mayor in the 2022 Ottawa municipal election.

## Registered candidates

### Brandon Bay

Brandon Bay was a local business owner and first-time candidate. His campaign focused on improving the city's transportation system and supporting small businesses.

### Zed Chebib

Zed Chebib was a local activist and community organizer. His campaign focused on addressing the city's affordable housing crisis and improving public services.

### Bob Chiarelli

Bob Chiarelli was a former mayor of Ottawa and a former provincial cabinet minister. His campaign focused on his experience and leadership skills.

### Bernard Couchman

Bernard Couchman was a local businessman and community leader. His campaign focused on improving the city's economy and supporting local businesses.

### Celine Debassige

Celine Debassige was a local community organizer and Indigenous leader. Her campaign focused on addressing the city's affordable housing crisis and improving services for Indigenous residents.

### Gregory "Jreg" Guevara

Gregory "Jreg" Guevara was a local artist and community organizer. His campaign focused on promoting arts and culture in the city and improving public services.

### Nour Kadri

Nour Kadri was a local community organizer and immigrant rights advocate. His campaign focused on addressing the city's affordable housing crisis and improving services for immigrant residents.

### Graham MacDonald

Graham MacDonald was a local business owner and community leader. His campaign focused on improving the city's transportation system and supporting small businesses.

### Mike Maguire

Mike Maguire was a local community organizer and environmental advocate. His campaign focused on addressing the city's environmental sustainability challenges and improving public services.

### Catherine McKenney

Catherine McKenney was a local community organizer and former city councillor. Her campaign focused on addressing the city's affordable housing crisis and improving services for vulnerable residents.

### Ade Olumide

Ade Olumide was a local business owner and community leader. His campaign focused on improving the city's economy and supporting local businesses.

### Param Singh

Param Singh was a local community organizer and social justice advocate. His campaign focused on addressing the city's affordable housing crisis and improving services for marginalized residents.

### Jacob Solomon

Jacob Solomon was a local community organizer and environmental advocate. His campaign focused on addressing the city's environmental sustainability challenges and improving public services.

### Mark Sutcliffe

Mark Sutcliffe was a local business owner and community leader. His campaign focused on improving the city's economy and supporting local businesses.

## Declined or dropped out

Several candidates declined to run or dropped out of the mayoral election, including former city councillor Diane Deans and local business owner and community leader, Michael LeBlanc.

## Issues

The 2022 Ottawa municipal election campaign focused on several key issues, including affordable housing, transportation, environmental sustainability, and public services.

## Endorsements

Several organizations and individuals endorsed candidates in the 2022 Ottawa municipal election, including the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board and the Ottawa Catholic School Board.

# Polls

Several polls were conducted during the 2022 Ottawa municipal election campaign, which showed a range of results. A poll conducted by Mainstreet Research in September 2022 showed Mark Sutcliffe in the lead, followed by Catherine McKenney and Bob Chiarelli.

# Debates and forums

Several debates and forums were held during the 2022 Ottawa municipal election campaign, which provided opportunities for candidates to discuss their platforms and answer questions from voters.

# Mayoral results

The results of the 2022 Ottawa municipal election were announced on October 24, 2022.

## Detailed results

The final results of the mayoral election were:

* Mark Sutcliffe: 51.1%
* Catherine McKenney: 24.1%
* Bob Chiarelli: 11.1%
* Other candidates: 13.7%

# City Council

The 2022 Ottawa municipal election also included elections for city councillors in each of the city's 24 wards.

article:
Vikram Vedha (2022 film)

Vikram Vedha is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language neo-noir action thriller film directed by Pushkar–Gayathri and produced by T-Series Films, Reliance Entertainment, Friday Filmworks, and YNOT Studios. The film is a remake of the 2017 Tamil film of the same name, which was also directed by Pushkar–Gayathri. The film stars Hrithik Roshan, Saif Ali Khan, Radhika Apte, and Rohit Saraf in key roles.

# Plot

The film is set in the city of Lucknow and revolves around the story of Vikram, a tough and honest police officer who is tasked with tracking down and killing Vedha, a notorious gangster. However, as Vikram delves deeper into the case, he discovers that Vedha's motives are not as clear-cut as they seem. Vedha, who is a master storyteller, begins to narrate a series of stories that challenge Vikram's perceptions and blur the lines between good and evil.

As the story unfolds, Vikram's obsession with capturing Vedha grows, but he also begins to question his own morality and the true nature of justice. Meanwhile, Vedha's stories weave a complex web of characters and events that lead to a thrilling climax.

# Cast

* Hrithik Roshan as Vedha
* Saif Ali Khan as Vikram
* Radhika Apte as Priya
* Rohit Saraf as Shatak
* Sharib Hashmi as Babloo
* Satyadeep Misra as SSP Abbas
* Yogita Bihani as Chanda

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in 2020, with Pushkar–Gayathri set to direct the remake of their 2017 Tamil film. The original film had received critical acclaim, and the makers were keen to adapt it for a wider audience. The script was written by Pushkar–Gayathri, along with Manoj Muntashir and Shreya Dev Verma.

## Casting

The casting process began in 2020, with Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan being approached for the lead roles. Both actors were impressed with the script and agreed to come on board. Radhika Apte was later cast as Priya, a key character in the film. Rohit Saraf, who had previously appeared in films like "Dear Zindagi" and "The Sky is Pink", was cast as Shatak, a young and ambitious police officer.

## Filming

Principal photography began in October 2021 and wrapped up in June 2022. The film was shot on location in Lucknow, with some scenes also filmed in Mumbai. The makers had planned to shoot some scenes in Dubai, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the schedule was altered.

# Music

The music for the film was composed by Vishal-Shekhar, with lyrics by Manoj Muntashir and Dev Kohli. The soundtrack features four songs, including the title track "Vikram Vedha", which was released in August 2022. The song received a positive response from music critics and audiences alike.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in July 2022, with the release of the first teaser poster. The makers released a series of character posters, featuring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in their respective roles. The film's trailer was released in August 2022 and received a positive response from audiences.

# Release

## Theatrical

The film was released theatrically on September 30, 2022. The makers had planned to release the film in 3D, but due to technical issues, the plan was dropped.

## Home media

The film will be available on digital platforms after its theatrical run. The makers have not announced a specific release date for the home media version.

# Reception

## Box office

The film received a positive response from audiences on its opening day, with many praising the performances of Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan. The film collected ₹10 crore on its opening day, with the total weekend collection standing at ₹25 crore. The film's box office performance was affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, but it still managed to collect ₹50 crore in its first week.

## Critical response

The film received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the performances of the lead actors. The film's direction, screenplay, and music were also praised. However, some critics felt that the film's pacing was slow and that the story was predictable.

# Accolades

The film has not won any major awards, but it has been nominated for several awards, including the Filmfare Awards and the IIFA Awards.

article:
Tu Jhoothi Main Makkaar is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language romantic comedy film directed by Luv Ranjan and written by Rahul Mody and Luv Ranjan. The film stars Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor in the lead roles, marking their first collaboration.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Rohan, a charming and successful event planner in his late 20s, who is struggling to find his perfect match. He meets Mira, a beautiful and confident young woman, at a friend's wedding, and they instantly connect. As they spend more time together, Rohan and Mira develop strong feelings for each other, but their relationship is put to the test when they face various challenges and misunderstandings.

As the story unfolds, Rohan and Mira must navigate their differences and confront their own flaws and weaknesses. Along the way, they learn valuable lessons about love, relationships, and themselves. The film takes the audience on a rollercoaster ride of emotions, from laughter and joy to tears and heartbreak.

# Cast

* Ranbir Kapoor as Rohan Arora
* Shraddha Kapoor as Mira
* Dimple Kapadia as Rohan's mother
* Boney Kapoor as Rohan's father
* Anubhav Singh Bassi as Rohan's friend
* Hasleen Kaur as Mira's friend
* Monica Chaudhary as Rohan's sister

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in December 2021, with Luv Ranjan set to direct and Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor starring in the lead roles. The script was written by Rahul Mody and Luv Ranjan, who have previously collaborated on several films.

## Casting

Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor were the first choices for the lead roles, and they were finalized soon after the project was announced. The rest of the cast, including Dimple Kapadia, Boney Kapoor, and Anubhav Singh Bassi, were added later.

## Filming

Principal photography began in January 2022 and wrapped up in August 2022. The film was shot in various locations, including Delhi, Mumbai, and Spain. The shooting schedule was tight, with the cast and crew working long hours to meet the deadline.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in November 2022, with the release of the first teaser poster. The trailer was released in December 2022 and received a positive response from the audience. The film's promotions were handled by the production team, who organized several events and activities to generate buzz around the film.

# Soundtrack

The film's soundtrack was composed by Pritam, with lyrics by Amitabh Bhattacharya. The album features six tracks, including the popular song "Tere Pyaar Mein". The soundtrack was released in January 2023 and received positive reviews from music critics.

# Release

## Theatrical

Tu Jhoothi Main Makkaar was released in theaters on March 8, 2023. The film received a wide release, with over 3000 screens in India and 1000 screens overseas.

## Home media

The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime Video, which released the film on its platform on April 28, 2023. The film's DVD and Blu-ray releases are expected to follow soon.

# Reception

## Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the performances of the lead actors and the film's music, while others found the storyline predictable and formulaic. The film holds a 50% approval rating on the review aggregation website Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews.

# Box office

Tu Jhoothi Main Makkaar performed moderately well at the box office, grossing over 100 crores in its first week. The film's collections dropped in the second week, but it managed to cross the 150 crore mark by the end of its third week. The film's worldwide gross is estimated to be over 200 crores.

article:
Pottery
================

Pottery is the art or craft of shaping, molding, and firing clay to create ceramic vessels, decorative items, and other objects. It has been a vital part of human culture for thousands of years, with evidence of pottery dating back to the Neolithic period. Pottery has played a significant role in the development of human societies, serving not only as a means of creating functional items but also as a form of artistic expression.

Main Types
------------

Pottery can be broadly classified into three main types based on the type of clay used, the firing temperature, and the resulting product.

### Earthenware

Earthenware is the most common type of pottery and is characterized by its earthy color and porous texture. It is made from a mixture of clay, water, and other minerals, and is fired at a relatively low temperature of around 1000°C (1832°F). Earthenware is often used to create functional items such as plates, bowls, and cups.

### Stoneware

Stoneware is a type of pottery that is fired at a higher temperature than earthenware, typically between 1100°C to 1300°C (2012°F to 2372°F). This results in a denser and more durable product that is often used to create functional items such as cups, mugs, and storage containers.

### Porcelain

Porcelain is a type of pottery that is known for its whiteness, translucency, and strength. It is made from a specific type of clay called kaolin and is fired at an even higher temperature than stoneware, typically between 1250°C to 1400°C (2282°F to 2552°F). Porcelain is often used to create decorative items such as vases, figurines, and fine china.

Archaeology
------------

The study of pottery plays a significant role in archaeology, as it can provide valuable information about a culture's technological, social, and economic development.

### Fabric Analysis

Fabric analysis is a technique used to analyze the composition and structure of pottery. By studying the fabric of a piece of pottery, archaeologists can determine the type of clay used, the firing temperature, and the techniques used to shape and decorate the piece.

Clay Bodies and Raw Materials
-----------------------------

Clay bodies are the mixture of clay, water, and other minerals used to create pottery. The type of clay used can affect the final product's texture, color, and durability. Raw materials used in pottery include clay, silica, feldspar, and quartz.

Production
------------

The production of pottery involves several stages, including shaping, drying, firing, and decorating.

### Shaping

Shaping is the process of creating the desired form from the clay body. This can be done using various techniques such as hand-building, throwing on a potter's wheel, or using a mold.

### Drying

Drying is the process of removing excess moisture from the clay body. This can be done using various methods such as air-drying, using a drying rack, or using a controlled environment.

### Firing

Firing is the process of heating the clay body to a high temperature to achieve the desired properties. The firing process involves several stages, including:

#### Temperature

The firing temperature can range from around 1000°C to 1400°C (1832°F to 2552°F), depending on the type of pottery being produced.

#### Atmosphere

The firing atmosphere can be either oxidizing or reducing, depending on the type of pottery being produced. An oxidizing atmosphere is used to produce bright colors and clear glazes, while a reducing atmosphere is used to produce darker colors and more subtle glazes.

#### Methods

There are several methods of firing, including:

* Electric kilns
* Gas kilns
* Wood-fired kilns
* Raku kilns

#### Stages

The firing process involves several stages, including:

* Bisque firing: This is the first firing stage, where the clay body is fired at a low temperature to remove excess moisture.
* Glaze firing: This is the second firing stage, where the glaze is applied and fired at a higher temperature.

Decorating
------------

Decorating is the process of adding visual interest to the pottery. Various methods can be used, including:

### Methods

* Hand-painting
* Slip trailing
* Stenciling
* Carving
* Glazing

Glazing
---------

Glazing is the process of applying a layer of glaze to the pottery. Glaze is a mixture of chemicals that is applied to the pottery and fired at a high temperature to achieve the desired color and texture.

Health and Environmental Issues
-------------------------------

The production of pottery can have health and environmental implications. For example:

* Inhaling clay dust can cause respiratory problems
* Using lead-based glazes can be toxic
* Firing pottery can release pollutants into the air

History
--------

The history of pottery dates back to the Neolithic period. Here is a brief overview of the history of pottery by region:

### Early Pottery

The earliest evidence of pottery dates back to around 9000 BC in the Fertile Crescent.

### Beginnings of Pottery

The beginnings of pottery can be found in the ancient civilizations of Mesopotamia, Egypt, and the Indus Valley.

### East Asia

Pottery has a long history in East Asia, dating back to the Neolithic period. The region is famous for its porcelain production, which began in the Han dynasty.

### South Asia

The Indus Valley Civilization is famous for its sophisticated pottery production, which dates back to around 2500 BC.

### Southeast Asia

Pottery has a long history in Southeast Asia, dating back to the Neolithic period. The region is famous for its earthenware production.

### West Asia

The ancient civilizations of Mesopotamia and Persia are famous for their pottery production, which dates back to around 4000 BC.

### Europe

Pottery has a long history in Europe, dating back to the Neolithic period. The region is famous for its earthenware and stoneware production.

### United Kingdom

The United Kingdom has a rich history of pottery production, dating back to the Roman era.

### Arabic Pottery

Arabic pottery has a long history, dating back to the Islamic Golden Age.

### Americas

Pottery has a long history in the Americas, dating back to the pre-Columbian era.

### Africa

Pottery has a long history in Africa, dating back to the Neolithic period.

### Oceania

Pottery has a relatively short history in Oceania, dating back to the arrival of European colonizers.

See Also
----------

* Ceramics
* Glass
* Metalwork
* Sculpture

References
----------

* None

Further Reading
----------------

* "The Potter's Bible" by Marylin Scott
* "The Ceramics Bible" by Louisa Taylor
* "The History of Pottery" by Emmanuel Cooper

External Links
----------------

* The British Museum's pottery collection
* The Metropolitan Museum of Art's pottery collection
* The Victoria and Albert Museum's pottery collection

Exodus of Kashmiri Hindus

The exodus of Kashmiri Hindus, also known as the Kashmiri Pandit exodus, was the forced migration of Kashmiri Hindus from the Kashmir Valley in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir. The exodus occurred in the early 1990s, as a result of the Kashmir insurgency, and is considered one of the largest and most tragic migrations of people in recent Indian history.

#Background

Kashmiri Hindus, also known as Kashmiri Pandits, have been an integral part of the Kashmir Valley's social fabric for centuries. They were the original inhabitants of the valley and had a distinct culture, language, and tradition. The Kashmiri Pandits were known for their learning, artistry, and administrative skills, and played a significant role in the region's politics, economy, and society.

In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, Kashmiri Pandits began to migrate to other parts of India in search of better opportunities. However, a significant number of them remained in the Kashmir Valley, where they continued to live and work.

In the 1980s, the Kashmir Valley began to experience a rise in Islamist militancy, which was fueled by the Soviet-Afghan War and the subsequent influx of Islamist fighters into the region. The militancy was further fueled by the Indian government's perceived neglect of the region's economic and social problems.

#Insurgency activity

The Kashmir insurgency, which began in the late 1980s, was led by a number of militant groups, including the Jammu Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) and the Hizbul Mujahideen. These groups sought to establish an independent Kashmir or merge it with Pakistan.

##Attack and threats

In the early 1990s, the Kashmir insurgency turned violent, with militant groups launching attacks on Kashmiri Hindus and other minority groups. The attacks were often brutal and included killings, kidnappings, and forced conversions.

article:
Kelly Townsend

Kelly Townsend is an American politician and activist from Arizona. She has been involved in various aspects of Arizona politics, including serving in the Arizona House of Representatives and Arizona Senate. Townsend has been a vocal advocate for conservative causes and has been involved in several high-profile controversies throughout her career.

#Early life and education

Kelly Townsend was born and raised in Arizona. She grew up in a conservative family and was homeschooled by her parents. Townsend developed an interest in politics at a young age and was involved in various extracurricular activities, including debate and student government. After completing her homeschooling education, Townsend attended a local community college, where she studied business and politics.

#Career

Before entering politics, Townsend worked as a business consultant and entrepreneur. She owned and operated several small businesses, including a marketing firm and a retail store. Townsend was also involved in various volunteer activities, including working with local charities and community organizations.

#Political career and electoral history

Townsend's entry into politics began with her involvement in local activism and advocacy groups. She quickly gained a reputation as a vocal and outspoken advocate for conservative causes, and her involvement in Arizona politics grew from there.

##Election activism

Townsend has been involved in various election-related activities, including serving as a precinct committeewoman and working on several local campaigns. She has also been a vocal advocate for election integrity and has called for increased transparency and security measures in Arizona's election system.

##Opposition Toward Former House Speaker Rusty Bowers

Townsend was a vocal critic of former Arizona House Speaker Rusty Bowers, with whom she frequently clashed over policy and procedure. She accused Bowers of being too moderate and of failing to adequately represent the interests of conservative Arizonans.

##History of Child Welfare System Activism and Judiciary Conflict

Townsend has been involved in various efforts to reform Arizona's child welfare system, which she has criticized for being overly bureaucratic and ineffective. She has also been involved in several high-profile conflicts with judges and other officials, whom she has accused of failing to adequately address issues related to child welfare and family law.

##School-related activism

Townsend has been a vocal advocate for education reform and has called for increased parental involvement in Arizona's schools. She has also been critical of what she sees as overreach by the federal government in education policy and has advocated for increased state and local control over education.

##Ballot Drop Box Monitoring and Voter Intimidation Allegations

Townsend was involved in a controversy surrounding the monitoring of ballot drop boxes in Arizona, which some critics accused her of using to intimidate voters. Townsend denied the allegations and maintained that she was simply trying to ensure the integrity of the election process.

##COVID-19 Mask Protest

Townsend was a vocal critic of mask mandates and other COVID-19-related restrictions imposed by the state and local governments. She organized several protests and rallies opposing the mandates and called for increased personal freedom and autonomy.

##Citizen Alleged Retaliation for Social Media Criticism

Townsend was accused of retaliating against a citizen who had criticized her on social media. The citizen alleged that Townsend had used her official position to target them and had attempted to intimidate them into silence. Townsend denied the allegations and maintained that she was simply defending herself against false and defamatory attacks.

##ALEC and Article V Convention Activism

Townsend has been involved with the American Legislative Exchange Council (ALEC) and has advocated for an Article V convention to amend the United States Constitution. She has called for increased state sovereignty and has advocated for reforms to the federal system.

##Governor Ducey COVID-19 Lockdown Protest

Townsend was a vocal critic of Governor Doug Ducey's COVID-19 lockdown policies and organized several protests opposing the restrictions. She called for increased personal freedom and autonomy and argued that the lockdowns were overly broad and ineffective.

##Arizona House of Representatives

Townsend served in the Arizona House of Representatives from 2013 to 2019. During her time in the House, she was a vocal advocate for conservative causes and was involved in several high-profile controversies.

##Arizona Senate

Townsend was elected to the Arizona Senate in 2020 and served a single term. During her time in the Senate, she continued to advocate for conservative causes and was involved in several high-profile controversies.

##Antisemitism Controversy with the Anti-Defamation League

Townsend was involved in a controversy with the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) over allegations of antisemitism. The ADL accused Townsend of making antisemitic comments and of promoting conspiracy theories about Jewish people. Townsend denied the allegations and maintained that she was simply expressing her opinions and advocating for conservative causes.

##Public Comment on Trump and Stormy Daniels Controversy

Townsend made headlines for her comments on the controversy surrounding President Donald Trump and adult film star Stormy Daniels. Townsend called for Trump to release any relevant information and argued that the controversy was a distraction from more important issues.

##McCain history and Agenda 21

Townsend has been a vocal critic of the late Senator John McCain and has accused him of being out of touch with conservative Arizonans. She has also been critical of Agenda 21, a United Nations sustainable development initiative that she sees as a threat to property rights and individual freedom.

##Patriot Party Movement of Arizona

Townsend has been involved with the Patriot Party movement in Arizona, which advocates for conservative causes and increased state sovereignty. She has called for increased activism and involvement in politics and has argued that conservatives must be more vocal and outspoken in advocating for their causes.

##Anti Abortion Activism

Townsend has been a vocal advocate for anti-abortion causes and has called for increased restrictions on abortion in Arizona. She has argued that abortion is morally wrong and has advocated for increased support for women and families.

##Failed Congressional Bid and Defeat in 2022 State Senate Primary

Townsend ran for Congress in 2022 but was defeated in the primary. She also lost her bid for re-election to the Arizona Senate, coming in third in the primary.

#Personal

Townsend is married with several children and lives in Gilbert, Arizona. She is a devout Christian and has been involved in various charitable and community organizations throughout her life.
